snippet: Japan, once a manufacturing powerhouse known for exports, is finding it must do what it has long resisted: welcome foreign manufacturers.
abstract: Japan, once a manufacturing powerhouse known for exports, is finding it must welcome foreign producers, something it has it has long resisted; even before the tsunami, the economy was listless from years of downsizing and moving factories offshore; this has resulted in a new power shift, with a small but rapidly increasing amount of capital coming from China.
lead_paragraph: Japan, once a manufacturing powerhouse known for exports, is finding it must do what it has long resisted: welcome foreign manufacturers.

headline.seo: Japan Looks Beyond Its Borders for Investors
headline.main: Japan Looks Beyond Its Borders for Investors
